title: Synthetic Recap
body:
In a display of defensive dominance rarely seen in the modern era, the New York Knicks authored a masterpiece, dismantling the Phoenix Suns 105-75 in a 1998 showdown that was over almost as soon as it began.

From the opening tip, the Knicks imposed their will, transforming the Phoenix court into a fortress of their own design. The game was a clinic in tenacity, with New York’s trademark physicality suffocating the Suns’ offense at every turn. Phoenix was held to a mere 75 points, their offensive sets broken apart by the relentless pressure of the Knicks’ defense, which created turnovers and fueled their own transition game.

While the final score was a testament to a complete team effort, the story was written by Knicks center Patrick Ewing. The legendary big man delivered a performance for the ages, pouring in a game-high 41 points. Ewing was simply unstoppable, operating with a ruthless efficiency in the post. Every drop-step, every turnaround jumper, and every powerful dunk chipped away at the Suns’ spirit. His 41-point eruption was the engine of the Knicks’ offense, a historic individual feat within a commanding team victory.

The Suns, overwhelmed and outmatched, found no answers. Their shooters went cold against the swarming defense, and their efforts to contain Ewing proved futile. The game served as a stark reminder of the Knicks’ championship-caliber grit and the towering presence of their leader, Patrick Ewing, on a night where he was truly immortal.
